Generation V.Black: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
Generation V.White: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don't return.
Generation V.Black 2: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.
Generation V.White 2: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.

Generation VI.X: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
Generation VI.Y: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.

Generation VIII.Sword: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon's rotation speed increases sharply.
Generation VIII.Shield: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.

Generation VIII.Sword: Route 10 , Dusty Bowl , Hammerlocke Hills Dusty Bowl , Giant's Seat , Hammerlocke Hills ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Route 10 , Dusty Bowl , Hammerlocke Hills Dusty Bowl , Giant's Seat , Hammerlocke Hills ( Max Raid Battle )
